directions: Plant the olive tree in well-draining soil and provide it with ample sunlight.
Water the olive tree regularly, making sure to keep the soil moist but not waterlogged.
Prune the tree to promote healthy growth and fruit production.
Wait for the tree to grow and produce olives. This can take several years.
Harvest the olives once they have ripened. This is usually done by handpicking the olives from the tree.
Brine the olives in a mixture of water and salt for several weeks to reduce their bitterness.
Rinse the olives and store them in a jar with olive oil and your choice of herbs and spices for added flavor, if desired.
Enjoy the olives as a snack or use them in various dishes and recipes.
